thread.title: Kristina Mladenovic sees off Urszula Radwanska at Tianjin Open
thread.title_full: Kristina Mladenovic sees off Urszula Radwanska at Tianjin Open

title: Kristina Mladenovic sees off Urszula Radwanska at Tianjin Open
text:
Kristina Mladenovic sees off Urszula Radwanska at Tianjin Open 14 Oct 2015 10:32:04 
comments 
Fifth seed Kristina Mladenovic is safely through to the third round of the Tianjin Open after beating Poland's Urszula Radwanska in straight sets on Wednesday. 
The world number 27 was tested throughout, having her serve broken three times, but crucial breaks in both sets saw the Frenchwoman eventually progress 6-4 6-4 in one hour and 44 minutes against her world number 88 opponent. 
Mladenovic will face Serbia's Bojana Jovanovski who comfortably beat Elena Vesnina, racing to a 6-3 6-1 win in just over an hour. 
Vesnina, who dumped out fourth seed Elina Svitolina on Monday, struggled against the Serb's first serve as Jovanovski won 81 per cent of her first service points to claim victory. 
Seventh seed Alison Riske was dumped out after losing in straight sets to Hungary's Timea Babos. The American was the bearer of her own downfall as she served four double faults in a 6-3 6-3 losing effort. 
Babos' reward is a quarter-final match-up against third seed Karolina Pliskova who breezed past Poland's Magda Linette 6-2 6-1. Related Sport News
